snippet: Abductions of Chinese workers in Sudan and Egypt have tested Beijing’s policy of noninterference and increased pressure to more aggressively protect its citizens abroad.

byline.original: By ANDREW JACOBS and JEFFREY GETTLEMAN
byline.contributor: Andrew Jacobs reported from Beijing, and Jeffrey Gettleman from Khartoum, Sudan. Mia Li contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Abductions of Chinese workers in Sudan and Egypt have tested Beijing’s policy of noninterference and increased pressure to more aggressively protect its citizens abroad.

headline.seo: China Under Pressure Over Kidnappings of Workers
headline.main: Kidnappings of Workers Put Pressure on China
headline.print_headline: Kidnappings of Workers Put Pressure on China
